issue.title: Splitwise Clone
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

A web app where friends track shared expenses and settle debts.

**Features:**
- Google OAuth + email/password login  
- Create expense groups, invite members
- Add expenses (split equally among members)
- Real-time balance calculations
- Settle up functionality
- Live updates with Socket.io

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- Lucide React icons
- SQLite with better-sqlite3
- NextAuth.js
- Socket.io

**Design:**
- Clean, minimal - not generic AI look
- Mobile-first responsive
- Use shadcn/ui components

**Pages:**
- Landing page
- Login/Signup
- Dashboard (list groups, balances)
- Group detail (expenses, members, balances)
- Create group dialog

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with TypeScript, configure Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui, set up project structure, install all dependencies (better-sqlite3, next-auth, socket.io, lucide-react), create .gitignore, package.json, tsconfig.json, and environment configuration files
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement authentication system with NextAuth.js, configure Google OAuth and email/password providers, create login/signup pages with shadcn/ui components, build session management API routes, and implement protected route middleware

workers.task: Set up NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth and Email/Password providers, create authentication API routes, and implement Prisma schema with User and Account models
Create authentication UI pages with shadcn/ui components including login form, signup form, and password reset functionality
Implement protected route middleware, session management utilities, and auth context provider for client-side authentication state

ems.task: Build database layer with better-sqlite3, design schema for users, groups, expenses, and settlements, create data access layer with prepared statements, implement SQLite database initialization and migration scripts

Implement core expense tracking logic including group creation, member invitations, expense addition with equal splitting, real-time balance calculations, and debt settlement algorithms, create Socket.io server for live updates

analysisSummary: Build a Splitwise-like expense sharing web app with Next.js 14, featuring OAuth authentication, expense group management, real-time balance tracking, and debt settlement functionality using Socket.io for live updates.
